figure_1.title: Figure 1. PRISMA flow diagram for systematic review process.

figure_2.title: Figure 2. The process of systematic review using the classification framework.

figure_4.title: Figure 4. Distribution analysis of reviewed journals per annum.

figure_5.title: Figure 5. Pareto analysis of journal publication.

figure_6.title: Figure 6. Generic framework for AI-based skin cancer detection system.

figure_7.title: Figure 7. Classification of AI models according to their level of complexity and adaptability.

claims.sentence: Figure 1 illustrates the selection study process using a PRISMA flowchart.

Open in a new tabPlanning and conducting the literature review
The first phase of our literature review includes planning the literature review, which consists of five crucial steps, as shown in Fig. 1.
Relevant factors were found for each dimension, as shown in Fig. 2.
The journal’s search methodologies for the review are presented in Table 1 and Fig. 3.
Figure 4 illustrates the number of articles published from 2019 to 2023 based on the keyword search discussed in ‘Inclusion Criteria’.

Open in a new tabDatabase distribution of articles
The Pareto analysis distribution of the chosen articles by database source is shown in Fig. 5.
The essential tools and algorithms used at each stage are summarized in Fig. 6, with Table 3 providing an overview of the methodologies used in skin cancer detection.
In Fig. 6, the ‘feature extraction and selection’ block applies specifically to traditional ML methods, where features are manually extracted and selected by the user.
Based on the defined ten criteria, DL models remain highly adaptable and complex to the medical AI application, as shown in Fig. 7.
Figure 1 illustrates the selection study process using a PRISMA flowchart.
